data.title: Implement more atomic ops
data.body:
**(Commits are meant to be squashed before merge.) Kept them to show the process better.**

Commit 1:
- The public API looks the same but with added overloads.
- The implementation uses templates or overloads depending on the context to avoid code duplication.

Commit 2:
- Implement add & subtract atomics.

The most error-prone things are the new add/sub functions for MSVC-Windows.

data.title: Weblate has conflicting entries for Chinese (Hong Kong): zh_HK and zh_Hant_HK
data.body:
**Issue description:**
I continue to translate godot for zh_HK and I don't know why there is now a Chinese(Hong Kong), if I click on zh_HK, it redirects me to https://hosted.weblate.org/projects/godot-engine/godot/zh_Hant_HK/ which has 0% translation. I have no idea how weblate handles locale and stuff. Could someone please tell me how to fix it, should I delete one and continue the translation?
![2017-07-11 21 27 10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10883749/28070514-c4153efa-667f-11e7-8805-9f9cf48870ba.png)

data.title: Checking if AStar point exists
data.body:
**Issue description:**
There is no command to check if point with a given ID exists in AStar.
get_point_pos ( int id ) const returns Vector3(0, 0, 0) if the point does not exists, but this is not null.
It is possible to add_point with this position and then there is no way to tell if this point exists or not.
Also get_point_weight_scale returns 0 if the point does not exists.

**Steps to reproduce:**
	var astar = AStar.new()
	astar.add_point(100, Vector3(0,0,0), 0)
	astar.add_point(200, Vector3(0,0,0), 0)
	astar.add_point(300, Vector3(0,0,0), 0)

That's all, you cannot check if point 200 is added or not.

**Suggestions:**
In a_star.cpp: points.has(p_id) is used to check if the point exists.
Add binding to expose this method to gdscript.

data.title: Revert "Improve reliability of memory stats"

data.title: OUYA Game Controller GUID for input_default.cpp
data.body:
Updated input_default.cpp to include the button mapping and GUID of the
OUYA Game Controller. This allows the controller itself to work on
Android devices, including the OUYA and hopefully this fixes issue #9390
for the 2.1.4

data.title: [#7212] Fixed missing 'Variant' return values in documentation.
data.body:
Sorry for this 3rd PR on the same simple issue. I didn't know it is not possible to re-open a PR when the head branch is recreated. ðŸ™‡

There is still methods in `Dictionary` where the return value needs to be defined: shall I create a `_bind_methods()` in `Dictionary.cpp` with the proper bindings ?

data.title: Property value saved as 1000000 is loaded as 106.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Antergos x86_64 - Godot master branch

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
| Saving | 1000000 (1e+6) | 10000000 (1e+7) | 1234567 | "1e+06".to_int() | "1e+06".to_float()
| - | - | - | - | - | - |
| Loading | 106 | 107 | 1234570 | 106 | 1000000

This doesn't affect exported var.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. New node with number property
2. Set that property larger than 1000000
3. Save, close, reload scene

data.title: Texture is displayed on wrong side of mesh
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Mate 16.04,
I3 3.6ghz, 4gb ram, nvidia gtx 750TI

Godot v3.0.alpha.custom_build

git clone on July 10th 2017

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
texture is displayed on wrong side of mesh

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. create a plane using blender, unwrap UV, assign material and texture
2. export object to .dae, import into godot project
3. load object into main scene
4. texture should be displayed on top side of plane, instead it's shown on bottom side of plane

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: [#7212] Fixed missing 'Variant' return values in documentation.
data.body:
I fixed some missing Variant return value in the documentation.

I'm am not done yet: there are still missing Variant return values in the `Dictionary` and `Geometry` documentation for
* Dictionary::back()
* Dictionary:: front()
* Dictionary::pop_back()
* Dictionary::pop_front()
* Geometry::ray_intersects_triangle()
* Geometry::segment_intersects_segment_2d()

There is no `_bind_methods()` defined in `Dictionary.h`: do I need to create one ?

Ps: I opened a [previous PR](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/9590) for this issue but I'm not able to select the correct branch when reopening it... sorry for that :/

data.title: Problem when try to use font with distance field.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Bug shows up when I try to load the same font second time in the same scene, for example to use it in label. After starting the game everything turns white, and one error pops up: "No loader found for resource: res://...". Adding something that updates constantly (like a particle emitter) "hides" the bug, just like turning off "Distance Field" on font.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Import font with distance field
2. Add two labels to your scene
3. Change labels font to that imported at the beginning
4. Write something in the labels
5. Run the project

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welco
me. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[example.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1136860/example.zip)

data.title: Fix picking list flood while mouse capture enabled
data.body:
The events were being added to the physics picking list, taking memory and also they would be processed when the mouse capturing was disabled, with unpredictable results.

Fixes #9575.

data.title: Rename Input::warp_mouse_pos() to set_mouse_position()
Remove warnings about benign situations
data.body:
I've extended the change done on https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/1e65c3c7019be69526c71aa09175010ba4a8e09f to `Area2D`-to-`Area2D` monitoring to `Area2D`-`PhysicsBody2D` and their 3D counterparts.

@akien-mga, would it be better when I submit almost identical PRs for 2.1 and 3.0 to describe one as a (back)port of the other?

Fixes #9534.

data.title: Include Git hash in the engine
data.body:
I'm not really sure about this PR whether the pros outweigh the cons. It might make issue tracking/regression pinpointing a bit easier? It's intended for those with precompiled binary so that they know which commit exactly they're using. The downside is that compiling takes longer.

![screenshot from 2017-07-10 19-10-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26753932/28017463-90b0aa36-65a3-11e7-96e5-590687ed35e7.png)

data.title: mac build / get_parent is returning boolean
data.body:
when using the latest mac build (july 9th) get_parent is returning a boolean type.
this also happened in the previous build (july 8th) and those were the only ones that I've tried.

my project is just a blank scene with 2 node2D objects. the child one is calling get_parent() on _ready(). really easy to reproduce. I think this is exclusive to the mac build since other linux users where not able to reproduce it.

data.title: Slider: add set/is_editable
data.body: Fixes #9574

data.title: Help wanted: New site aim to make godot more popular in china
data.body:
Dear developers of godot game engine,

Thanks for your hard working with the open source game engine. Godot is really a good game engine. I love the engine and I think all developers would love it after using it. Unfortunately, most game developers in China do not know the existence of this excellent engine.

We (some godoters in china) are tring to share the engine with others. A lot of developers joined us to try the new engine. The group could be called as the Chinese community and it is growing up.

But there always problems when we share godot with others:
1. The official site is blocked by the evil fire wall in some area.
2. The official site and documentation page is too slow to open in some area.
3. People are poor of english like me to understand the advantages of the engine and documentations.

To solve these problems we setup a translated website here:
http://godot.studio

We hope we can get support from the official godot community.
Could you please redirect the domains below to our site to make us likes more official so we could be more confident to share with others.

* cn.godotengine.org
* zh.godotengine.org

And maybe add a link in the official site.

Thanks for your reading.

Geequlim

data.title: Fixed issues with borderless windows on Windows
data.body:
Fixes setting / unsetting borderless windows on the run on windows (fixes #7186).
Also makes it possible to use a borderless fullscreen window using this GDscript:

```
OS.set_borderless_window(true)
OS.set_window_size(OS.get_screen_size())
OS.set_window_position(Vector2(0, 0))
```

And unsetting this mode with a simple:

`
OS.set_borderless_window(false)
`

data.title: Added get_bus_index to AudioServer
data.body: Implements proposed enhancement #9171

data.title: Redistribute error constants values
data.body:
On the global scope, the error constants start with `OK = 0` and then, for each next item, the value increases `1`; so you have:
```
OK = 0
FAILED = 1
ERR_UNAVAILABLE = 2
ERR_UNCONFIGURED = 3
ERR_UNAUTHORIZED = 4
...
```
But it's not like this all the way to the end, there are some breaks, like this:

```
ERR_LOCKED = 23
ERR_TIMEOUT = 24
ERR_CANT_AQUIRE_RESOURCE = 28
ERR_INVALID_DATA = 30
ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER = 31
```

data.title: Fix crash on closing [empty](*) scene tab
Crash when running sqrt(-1) and log(-1)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux. Godot 2.1.4 at commit [171d8a5](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/171d8a501ff97d4655ba4a7317822d41474eb4bc).

**Issue description:**
Godot crashes when trying to run `sqrt(-1)` or `log(-1)`.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a new project, add a node and a script.
2. Put  `print(sqrt(-1))` or `print(log(-1))` under `_ready()`.
3. Run the scene.
4. The editor will crash.

**Additional info:**
Terminal output when trying to run the scene:
```
ERROR: operator[]: SEVERE: Index p_index out of size (size()).
   At: core/vector.h:136.
```
When I open godot, select the project and click the `edit` button, the same error appears and the program freezes.

This bug is not on 2.1.3.

data.title: EditorNode: add floating dock
data.body:
Enable in `docks/floating_docks/*` (Disabled by default)

Distraction-free mode is great, but I can't quickly reach the docks without turning it off.

Known issues:
1. Toggling `interface/floating_docks` will make editor unusable, must relaunch first.
2. Can't drag dock's edge to resize
3. ~~Docks can't be kept open to signify editor events (i.e. double-click resource to edit)~~
4. ~~Dragging file from one dock to another doesn't work?~~
5. The old `editor_layout.cfg` might have to be deleted first

It's still very rough. I'm not sure if this feature is desired. Please test/review. Thank you.
Also I don't think 'floating' is the right term. I can't think of anything better right now.

Screencast:
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/319449314902671360/333635010286452736/2017-07-09_22-44-42.mp4
